fee_structure.time_of_payment: Within seven days of the declaration of the Selection Process Result

eligibility:
Minimum Eligibility: PUC/10 +2 from across Boards ((Karnataka PUC, ISCE, CBSE, NIOS, other State Boards), and recognized bodies in India.).
Candidates writing the +2 examinations in March-May 2025 may apply with their class X and XI marks.
Students pursuing International curriculum must note that eligibility is according to AIU stipulations:
Applicants pursuing IB curriculum must have 3 HL and 3 SL with 24 credits.
Applicants pursuing GCE / Edexcel must have a minimum of 3 A levels with a grade not less than C.
why_choose: Why choose this course? Interdisciplinary & multidisciplinary curriculum Industry-oriented courses and Internships Exposure to literary, cultural & language studies Projects, dissertations, and research internships. Student-led conferences, seminars, clubs & fests Self-directed learning and Academic Mentoring
what_learn: What you will learn? Emergent discourses, key concepts, theories, and analytical frameworks in English studies, cultural studies, and linguistics. The role of language and cultural representations in society through research and community engagement. Content Design, Editing, Publishing, Translation, Machine Translation, NLP Frameworks, Pedagogy, and Curriculum Design. Social sensitivity on issues related to ethics, gender, environment, sustainability, and equity. Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities through textual and cultural analysis. Written and oral communication skills for academic and professional contexts.
modules: Modules Academic and Literary Skills Introductory Linguistics Textualities and Digital Textualities Year 1 Classical and Contemporary British Literature Editing and Content Writing Service Learning Internship Travel and City Narratives Semantics and Pragmatics. Literary Criticism     and Cultural Theory Year 2 Research Writing Writing and Publishing for Children Folkloristics Indian and Postcolonial Literatures Visual culture and film studies Language teaching and pedagogy Year 3 Gender and environmental discourses Marginality and disability studies Popular Culture Studies Urban Studies Creative and Cultural Industries Gender and environmental discourses Year 4 Digital Humanities Ethnography Food Studies
career: Career prospects Technical writing, content creation, editing, and publishing Teaching and Research Journalism and mass communication Translator, subtitler, interpreter and language analyst. Scriptwriting, documentary production, and film critic Museum curation and heritage management
